Data: Did anyone say "I want more women's wrestling anime?" .... No? Didn't think so. ―  Wanna-Be's Lately there's been a lot of chatter about the girls' wrestling TV series, Wanna Be The Strongest In The World. Given that virtually none of the chatter is positive, I'm not really making plans to check out the show for myself. But hearing about a mediocre girls' wresting anime did jog my memory about anothe...

My Dress-Up Darling Episode 12  by MrAJCosplay/Cartoon Cipher, Mar 28th 2022                   How would you rate episode 12 of My Dress-Up Darling ?                     Community score: 4.7            Because the fanservice and the cosplay insights are oftentimes My Dress-Up Darling's biggest attention grabbers – as well as being some of the primary elements the show is marketed on – I was genuinely shocked when it decided to end on a note that embraces neither of those things. Instead, this episode cements My Dress-Up Darling as a romance about two characters coming into their own all along, and while I think the show could have definitely made this more of a focus earlier on, it still makes for one of the best season finales one could hope for.    In terms of narrative progression, there's not a lot that goes on in this episode. We don't really see a lot of the other characters we got introduced to outside of the main duo, and cosplay is barely even mentioned aside from one or two small conversation points (my favorite is the scene towards the beginning where Gojo isn't affected by a horror movie because he's focusing so hard on things like the makeup and costume design). This is just an episode about Gojo and Kitagawa living out the last days of their summer break, spending time together and fortifying the foundation of their relationship that has been slowly building up to this point. We get scenes of Kitagawa getting in over her head and needing to rely on Gojo to help keep her steady, and it's clear that Gojo appreciates Kitagawa for taking him out to experience things that he never really got the chance to. It's not like there was really anything stopping him from experiencing these things on his own, but this boy had grown to be so accepting of his loneliness due to his childhood trauma that he probably just came to his own conclusion that he could never be a part of social gatherings like that. So Kitagawa not only going with him to the festival but also casually bringing up that they will do more things together next year means the world to him, and those quiet moments where he's just staring off into the scenery or appreciating the beautiful ball of energy that steamrolled into his life genuinely moved me.    A couple reviews ago I mentioned how I almost didn't want these two to get together too quickly despite Kitagawa realizing her feelings for Gojo early on, as I think the characters needed to come to terms with how they view themselves before they would be ready to commit to something like a romantic relationship. This episode was definitely a step in that direction as Gojo begins to further appreciate and accept the fact that he does not need to be alone anymore while Kitagawa continues to rely on Gojo as a source of support and understanding. I love these two characters and I look forward to the day when I might be able to see them come together as equals. Despite all of the unabashed horniness and some questionable and borderline problematic practices the show touches upon, you will never convince me that My Dress Up Darling doesn't have a heart. It might take some time to get it, and some might feel like it's not worth trying to find in the first place, but that heart was strong enough to carry me all the way to the end of the show and also consider it one of the better slice of life anime that I've seen in a bit. My Dress-Up Darling Episode 12  by MrAJCosplay/Cartoon Cipher, Mar 28th 2022                   How would you rate episode 12 of My Dress-Up Darling ?                     Community score: 4.7            Because the fanservice and the cosplay insights are oftentimes My Dress-Up Darling's biggest attention grabbers – as well as being some of the primary elements the show is marketed on – I was genuinely shocked when it decided to end on a note that embraces neither of those things. Instead, this episode cements My Dress-Up Darling as a romance about two characters coming into their own all along, and while I think the show could have definitely made this more of a focus earlier on, it still makes for one of the best season finales one could hope for.    In terms of narrative progression, there's not a lot that goes on in this episode. We don't really see a lot of the other characters we got introduced to outside of the main duo, and cosplay is barely even mentioned aside from one or two small conversation points (my favorite is the scene towards the beginning where Gojo isn't affected by a horror movie because he's focusing so hard on things like the makeup and costume design). This is just an episode about Gojo and Kitagawa living out the last days of their summer break, spending time together and fortifying the foundation of their relationship that has been slowly building up to this point. We get scenes of Kitagawa getting in over her head and needing to rely on Gojo to help keep her steady, and it's clear that Gojo appreciates Kitagawa for taking him out to experience things that he never really got the chance to. It's not like there was really anything stopping him from experiencing these things on his own, but this boy had grown to be so accepting of his loneliness due to his childhood trauma that he probably just came to his own conclusion that he could never be a part of social gatherings like that. So Kitagawa not only going with him to the festival but also casually bringing up that they will do more things together next year means the world to him, and those quiet moments where he's just staring off into the scenery or appreciating the beautiful ball of energy that steamrolled into his life genuinely moved me.    A couple reviews ago I mentioned how I almost didn't want these two to get together too quickly despite Kitagawa realizing her feelings for Gojo early on, as I think the characters needed to come to terms with how they view themselves before they would be ready to commit to something like a romantic relationship. This episode was definitely a step in that direction as Gojo begins to further appreciate and accept the fact that he does not need to be alone anymore while Kitagawa continues to rely on Gojo as a source of support and understanding. I love these two characters and I look forward to the day when I might be able to see them come together as equals. Despite all of the unabashed horniness and some questionable and borderline problematic practices the show touches upon, you will never convince me that My Dress Up Darling doesn't have a heart. It might take some time to get it, and some might feel like it's not worth trying to find in the first place, but that heart was strong enough to carry me all the way to the end of the show and also consider it one of the better slice of life anime that I've seen in a bit.    Rating:                 My Dress-Up Darling is currently streaming on Crunchyroll and Funimation.   <prevEpisode 1-2 Episode 3 Episode 4 Episode 5 Episode 6 Episode 7 Episode 8 Episode 9 Episode 10 Episode 11 Episode 12     discuss this in the forum (341 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               back to My Dress-Up Darling Episode Review homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            news          14 comments       Makoto Shinkai Unveils New Anime Film Suzume no Tojimari's Heroine, November 11 Opening   Apr 10, 07:52 14 comments                 anime    Still also posted before teaser's debut on Sunday ― Makoto Shinkai (your name., Weathering With You) revealed the title heroine's visual, a still, and the November 11 opening for his first new film in three years, Suzume no Tojimari (literally, Suzume's Door-Locking), on Saturday. It might take some time to get it, and some might feel like it's not worth trying to find in the first place, but that heart was strong enough to carry me all the way to the end of the show and also consider it one of the better slice of life anime that I've seen in a bit.    Rating:                 My Dress-Up Darling is currently streaming on Crunchyroll and Funimation.   <prevEpisode 1-2 Episode 3 Episode 4 Episode 5 Episode 6 Episode 7 Episode 8 Episode 9 Episode 10 Episode 11 Episode 12     discuss this in the forum (341 posts) |        bookmark/share with:               back to My Dress-Up Darling Episode Review homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

Title: Episode 12 - My Dress-Up Darling [2022-03-28] - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: My Dress-Up Darling Episode 12  by MrAJCosplay/Cartoon Cipher, Mar 28th 2022                   How would you rate episode 12 of My Dress-Up Darling ?                     Community score: 4.7            Because the fanservice and the cosplay insights are oftentimes My Dress-Up Darling's biggest attention grabbers – as well as being some of the primary elements the show is marketed on – I was genuinely shocked when it decided to end on a note that embraces neither of those things. Instead, this episode cements My Dress-Up Darling as a romance about two characters coming into their own all along, and while I think the show could have definitely made this more of a focus earlier on, it still makes for one of the best season finales one could hope for.    In terms of narrative progression, there's not a lot that goes on in this episode. We don't really see a lot of the other characters we got introduced to outside of the main duo, and cosplay is barely even mentioned aside from one or two small conversation points (my favorite is the scene towards the beginning where Gojo isn't affected by a horror movie because he's focusing so hard on things like the makeup and costume design). This is just an episode about Gojo and Kitagawa living out the last days of their summer break, spending time together and fortifying the foundation of their relationship that has been slowly building up to this point. We get scenes of Kitagawa getting in over her head and needing to rely on Gojo to help keep her steady, and it's clear that Gojo appreciates Kitagawa for taking him out to experience things that he never really got the chance to. It's not like there was really anything stopping him from experiencing these things on his own, but this boy had grown to be so accepting of his loneliness due to his childhood trauma that he probably just came to his own conclusion that he could never be a part of social gatherings like that. So Kitagawa not only going with him to the festival but also casually bringing up that they will do more things together next year means the world to him, and those quiet moments where he's just staring off into the scenery or appreciating the beautiful ball of energy that steamrolled into his life genuinely moved me.    A couple reviews ago I mentioned how I almost didn't want these two to get together too quickly despite Kitagawa realizing her feelings for Gojo early on, as I think the characters needed to come to terms with how they view themselves before they would be ready to commit to something like a romantic relationship. This episode was definitely a step in that direction as Gojo begins to further appreciate and accept the fact that he does not need to be alone anymore while Kitagawa continues to rely on Gojo as a source of support and understanding. I love these two characters and I look forward to the day when I might be able to see them come together as equals. Despite all of the unabashed horniness and some questionable and borderline problematic practices the show touches upon, you will never convince me that My Dress Up Darling doesn't have a heart. It might take some time to get it, and some might feel like it's not worth trying to find in the first place, but that heart was strong enough to carry me all the way to the end of the show and also consider it one of the better slice of life anime that I've seen in a bit. Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). Title: Home - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives

Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview! Title: Home - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook. Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.

News Voice Actress/Singer Kana Hanazawa Diagosed With COVID-19, Cancels Concert   posted on 2022-04-07 22:37 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Hanazawa had sore throat on April 5    Talent agency Office Osawa announced on Thursday that voice actress and singer Kana Hanazawa has been diagnosed with the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19). She had a sore throat on the evening of April 5, so she took a PCR test and ended up testing positive. She will receive treatment according to the guidelines of the health center.    Her "Hanazawa Kana Live 2022 'blossom' Kobe performance," which was scheduled for April 10 in Kobe, has been cancelled.    Hanazawa has performed theme songs for Bakemonogatari, The Quintessential Quintuplets, Cells at Work!, Oreimo, and Nisekoi. Her numerous major anime roles include Steins;Gate's Mayuri, Durarara!!'s Anri, Psycho-Pass' Akane Tsunemori, Cells at Work!'s Red Blood Cell, OREIMO's Kuroneko, Demon Slayer's Mitsuri Kanroji, The Quintissential Quintuplets' Ichika, and Monogatari's Nadeko Sengoku. She has had leading and cameo roles in Makoto Shinkai's films, including Yukino in The Garden of Words and Mitsuha's similar-looking teacher in your name. News Voice Actress/Singer Kana Hanazawa Diagosed With COVID-19, Cancels Concert   posted on 2022-04-07 22:37 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Hanazawa had sore throat on April 5    Talent agency Office Osawa announced on Thursday that voice actress and singer Kana Hanazawa has been diagnosed with the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19). She had a sore throat on the evening of April 5, so she took a PCR test and ended up testing positive. She will receive treatment according to the guidelines of the health center.    Her "Hanazawa Kana Live 2022 'blossom' Kobe performance," which was scheduled for April 10 in Kobe, has been cancelled.    Hanazawa has performed theme songs for Bakemonogatari, The Quintessential Quintuplets, Cells at Work!, Oreimo, and Nisekoi. Her numerous major anime roles include Steins;Gate's Mayuri, Durarara!!'s Anri, Psycho-Pass' Akane Tsunemori, Cells at Work!'s Red Blood Cell, OREIMO's Kuroneko, Demon Slayer's Mitsuri Kanroji, The Quintissential Quintuplets' Ichika, and Monogatari's Nadeko Sengoku. She has had leading and cameo roles in Makoto Shinkai's films, including Yukino in The Garden of Words and Mitsuha's similar-looking teacher in your name. Title: Voice Actress/Singer Kana Hanazawa Diagosed With COVID-19, Cancels Concert - News - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Hanazawa had sore throat on April 5    Talent agency Office Osawa announced on Thursday that voice actress and singer Kana Hanazawa has been diagnosed with the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19). She had a sore throat on the evening of April 5, so she took a PCR test and ended up testing positive. She will receive treatment according to the guidelines of the health center.    Her "Hanazawa Kana Live 2022 'blossom' Kobe performance," which was scheduled for April 10 in Kobe, has been cancelled.    Hanazawa has performed theme songs for Bakemonogatari, The Quintessential Quintuplets, Cells at Work!, Oreimo, and Nisekoi. Her numerous major anime roles include Steins;Gate's Mayuri, Durarara!!'s Anri, Psycho-Pass' Akane Tsunemori, Cells at Work!'s Red Blood Cell, OREIMO's Kuroneko, Demon Slayer's Mitsuri Kanroji, The Quintissential Quintuplets' Ichika, and Monogatari's Nadeko Sengoku. She has had leading and cameo roles in Makoto Shinkai's films, including Yukino in The Garden of Words and Mitsuha's similar-looking teacher in your name.   Sources: Office Osawa, Oricon News via Otakomu        discuss this in the forum (8 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives

Back to top                  Lord Geo    Joined: 18 Sep 2005 		    Posts: 2091 		    Location: North Brunswick, New Jersey 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:16 pm              Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            Akira Kamiya is also, from last I heard, one of the most expensive seiyuu in the entire anime industry, because of how legendary he is, so I would imagine it's more cost-effective to just do movies, while still casting him as Ryo. Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using.   Also, with him being 75 right now, I imagine Kamiya himself prefers being semi-retired & not having to work on a weekly production, at this point. Title: NEWS: City Hunter Series Gets New Anime Film - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.              Forum - View topicNEWS: City Hunter Series Gets New Anime Film             Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        Zhou-BR    Joined: 28 Feb 2008 		    Posts: 1293       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:17 pm            I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?      Back to top                  -Matthew-    Joined: 12 Mar 2022 		    Posts: 58       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:18 pm            Great news! I hope someday whole manga will be adapted also.      Back to top                  MakiharaMeiko    Joined: 06 Mar 2017 		    Posts: 57       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:46 pm            They are begging for a remake didn't they??? hahahaha (I wish)   I hope they could adapt what's left in the manga, but I will not say no to more content, even if it's original. I could see more Saeba for the rest of my life and I will not complain <3      Back to top                  johnnysasaki    Joined: 01 Jun 2014 		    Posts: 747       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:59 pm              Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            he has been working very sporadically since the 00's.It's probably due to his age(despite the fact there are older VAs more active than him) and for being supposedly one of the most expensive voice-actors to hire in Japan.That's probably why he was replaced in Detective Conan.      Back to top                  Lord Geo    Joined: 18 Sep 2005 		    Posts: 2091 		    Location: North Brunswick, New Jersey 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:16 pm              Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            Akira Kamiya is also, from last I heard, one of the most expensive seiyuu in the entire anime industry, because of how legendary he is, so I would imagine it's more cost-effective to just do movies, while still casting him as Ryo. Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using.   Also, with him being 75 right now, I imagine Kamiya himself prefers being semi-retired & not having to work on a weekly production, at this point.      Back to top                   NJ_    Joined: 31 Oct 2009 		    Posts: 2613 		    Location: Wallington, NJ 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:17 pm            The last movie was so much fun so hopefully this will be as good.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3825       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:38 pm            Another City Hunter movie? Cool!      Back to top                  thekingsdinner    Joined: 25 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 967 		    Location: Geertruidenberg, Netherlands 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:42 pm            I'm absolutely on board for more City Hunter!      Back to top                     omnistry    Joined: 03 Mar 2005 		    Posts: 990       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 7:05 pm            It’d be cool if they found a way to do a Dirty Pair crossover.      Back to top                   xxmsxx    Joined: 06 Sep 2017 		    Posts: 358       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 8:33 pm              Lord Geo wrote:    Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using            The most popular thing telephoned amongst Conan fans about him is that his contract with the show was up for re-negotiation and neither side was willing to budge. He posted something on his social media one day complaining, but took it down quickly. In this sense, he could still work on other productions. But yes, like you said, he could be semi-retired as well.   Generally, pretty happy to hear the news.      Back to top                  Supermutant    Joined: 26 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 358       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 9:20 pm            Things I didn't expect in 2022 for 500 alex      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 222       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 11:21 pm            Hell Yeah!   the last of my City Hunter series Blu-Rays from Discotek came in not that long ago. I thought the last movie they did was 10 out of 10 for City Hunter fans. I got to meet a bunch of the cast at Anime Boston a couple years ago.      Lord Geo wrote:    Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using          I can see that, its a shame because he was a great Kogoro. it's also surprising when the VA for goku is still going and she's into her late 80's      Back to top                Display posts from previous: All Posts 1 Day 7 Days 2 Weeks 1 Month 3 Months 6 Months 1 Year Oldest First Newest First              Anime News Network Forum Index     -> Site-related 	  -> Talkback  All times are GMT - 5 Hours    Page 1 of 1         	              Powered by phpBB © 2001, 2005 phpBB Group           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

Title: NEWS: City Hunter Series Gets New Anime Film - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        Zhou-BR    Joined: 28 Feb 2008 		    Posts: 1293       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:17 pm            I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?      Back to top                  -Matthew-    Joined: 12 Mar 2022 		    Posts: 58       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:18 pm            Great news! I hope someday whole manga will be adapted also.      Back to top                  MakiharaMeiko    Joined: 06 Mar 2017 		    Posts: 57       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:46 pm            They are begging for a remake didn't they??? hahahaha (I wish)   I hope they could adapt what's left in the manga, but I will not say no to more content, even if it's original. I could see more Saeba for the rest of my life and I will not complain <3      Back to top                  johnnysasaki    Joined: 01 Jun 2014 		    Posts: 747       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 4:59 pm              Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            he has been working very sporadically since the 00's.It's probably due to his age(despite the fact there are older VAs more active than him) and for being supposedly one of the most expensive voice-actors to hire in Japan.That's probably why he was replaced in Detective Conan.      Back to top                  Lord Geo    Joined: 18 Sep 2005 		    Posts: 2091 		    Location: North Brunswick, New Jersey 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:16 pm              Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            Akira Kamiya is also, from last I heard, one of the most expensive seiyuu in the entire anime industry, because of how legendary he is, so I would imagine it's more cost-effective to just do movies, while still casting him as Ryo. Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using.   Also, with him being 75 right now, I imagine Kamiya himself prefers being semi-retired & not having to work on a weekly production, at this point.      Back to top                   NJ_    Joined: 31 Oct 2009 		    Posts: 2613 		    Location: Wallington, NJ 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:17 pm            The last movie was so much fun so hopefully this will be as good.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3825       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:38 pm            Another City Hunter movie? Cool!      Back to top                  thekingsdinner    Joined: 25 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 967 		    Location: Geertruidenberg, Netherlands 		        Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 5:42 pm            I'm absolutely on board for more City Hunter!      Back to top                     omnistry    Joined: 03 Mar 2005 		    Posts: 990       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 7:05 pm            It’d be cool if they found a way to do a Dirty Pair crossover.      Back to top                   xxmsxx    Joined: 06 Sep 2017 		    Posts: 358       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 8:33 pm              Lord Geo wrote:    Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using            The most popular thing telephoned amongst Conan fans about him is that his contract with the show was up for re-negotiation and neither side was willing to budge. He posted something on his social media one day complaining, but took it down quickly. In this sense, he could still work on other productions. But yes, like you said, he could be semi-retired as well.   Generally, pretty happy to hear the news.      Back to top                  Supermutant    Joined: 26 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 358       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 9:20 pm            Things I didn't expect in 2022 for 500 alex      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 222       Posted: Thu Apr 07, 2022 11:21 pm            Hell Yeah!   the last of my City Hunter series Blu-Rays from Discotek came in not that long ago. I thought the last movie they did was 10 out of 10 for City Hunter fans. I got to meet a bunch of the cast at Anime Boston a couple years ago.      Lord Geo wrote:    Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using          I can see that, its a shame because he was a great Kogoro. it's also surprising when the VA for goku is still going and she's into her late 80's      Back to top                Display posts from previous: All Posts 1 Day 7 Days 2 Weeks 1 Month 3 Months 6 Months 1 Year Oldest First Newest First              Anime News Network Forum Index     -> Site-related 	  -> Talkback  All times are GMT - 5 Hours    Page 1 of 1         	              Powered by phpBB © 2001, 2005 phpBB Group

Data: Zhou-BR wrote:    I wish they could make a final TV series adapting what's left of the manga instead of making an original movie every now and then. Does Akira Kamiya just not have the energy to work on a weekly TV show again?            Akira Kamiya is also, from last I heard, one of the most expensive seiyuu in the entire anime industry, because of how legendary he is, so I would imagine it's more cost-effective to just do movies, while still casting him as Ryo. Hell, he stopped voicing Kogoro Mori in Detective Conan back in 2009 (Rikiya Koyama has voiced Mori ever since), possibly because he just got too expensive to continue using.   Also, with him being 75 right now, I imagine Kamiya himself prefers being semi-retired & not having to work on a weekly production, at this point.
